title: [Large-Scale] Language Learning Design Decision-Making Workshop: Integration of Scientific Inquiry and Practical Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language learning experience (grammar/vocabulary comprehension), digital device proficiency, foundational text analysis, and understanding of scientific inquiry methods
context.additional_context: Language education curriculum conducted in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments. Features asynchronous activities (writing feedback, reading discussions) and evidence-based summative assessments via LMS, focusing on improving expressive and reading skills. Emphasizes cultivating contextual language use through diverse text types (expository, argumentative, narrative).

learning_goals: Explain systematic design methods for learning activity variables (grammatical structures, lexical networks, contextual elements) based on language acquisition theories (e.g., input hypothesis, output hypothesis) using scientific inquiry approaches
Apply a process for evaluating/improving learning design elements (grammatical structures, lexical choices, communicative effectiveness) through peer feedback and evidence-based analysis

Analyze three cases of integrated reading-writing activities within LMS platforms (e.g., Google Classroom, Moodle), submit inquiry result reports incorporating peer evaluation/feedback within two weeks

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
